Id	Type	Level	Bro Name	Name 0	N 1	N 2	N 3	N 4	N 5	N 6	N 7	N 8	BD	ShortName	Master	Ref	TxId	Hys	TupId	Data Type	Sign	Acct Types	Post Type	RO	ExclDims	AllowDims	DiMes	NoTags	Except	Amort	Sum Up	Check	StartEnd	Context	Zones	Order	Descr	Comment	Scratch	I Tx Std Label	I Usable Dims	I Post Usable Dims	I M# DiMe Info	I Tag	I Tx Type	I Tx Period	I StartEnd	I Tx Sign	I Tx Hys	I Tuple	I Slave Ids	I Slave Filtering
#	Structure	#############################################################################################################
#	Input	DE Codes - PL Income Expenses From 1000										Input
#	Input	DE Codes - BS Assets Liabilities From 2000										Input
#	Input	DE Codes - For CF and RMSF. From 3000										Input
#	Input	Non DE Codes - Schedules. Sch etc.										Input
#	Calcs	Defintion Tree
#	Calcs	Calculation Link (UK GAAP 2008-01-15)
#	Calcs	Calculations - DE Money (e.g. Subtotals, Totals and any other compound RO entries). Order PL then BS.										Calculations
#	Calcs	Calculations - Unit or KPI type figures. (Note these may be better handled outside of BROs)										Calculations
#	Output	Schedules - Output										Output
#	Output	Primary Report output e.g. PL, BS Cflow etc. (Note these may end up just being handled by RG section.)										Output
#	NonBROS	Anything that looks as though it should go straight to the Report Generator (RG)
#	######################################################################################################################
#	There may be an argument for making Schedules and Primary Report both Input and Output. i.e. not try to separated them into distinct sections of the the Bros. Ratioanle is that often a Sch or Preport will just directly reflect an Input as Output. (Othewise it will be a Calculation).
#	PL DE Codes Start		################################################################################################
#

#	CW 07/08/2012. Re Investment Properties. Note that is is identified as a separate TFA Class - TFAClasses.InvestProperties. HyId 23 Dim 10. DiMeId 2918. Note that the Dim 11 re Ownership can also apply e.g. an investment property could be on a short or long lease as well as freehold.
#	Whilst it should not affect the construction of BROs, there is no legal requirement for Investment Properties to be shown separately on the face of the BS or in a separate note from other TFAs, though amounts should be shown at the foot of the note in this case. This is an RG point to remember.

2052	Set	2	    Assets.Fixed.Investments	 		Investments														Money	Debit	BS	DE								 +								[A] 2141 FixedAssetInvestmentsIncludingSubsidiariesParticipatingInterestsOtherInvestments-MovementAnalysesHeading
#	Fixed Asset Investent - Dimension other (197) would qualify as being Financial Assets within defintions of FRS 13 and FRS 25.
#	They would match back to FI - Primary - Asset - Categories a) Held to Maturity Investments and b) Available for Sale Financial Assets. But both these categories have a Current and Non Current dimension.
#	So any check, whether in BROs or RG needs to isolate FAI Dim FAIHoldings.Others (197). Then further isolate FinInstrCurrentNonCurrent.NonCurrent (240) to show as Fixed or FinInstrCurrentNonCurrent.Current (241) to show as Current.

#	TxId 1236 and TxId 1705 should be the same value. Would only be different if Discounted Provisions was a debit balance. In which case it should match with TxId 1233.
#	Do not think you can have TxId 1236 and 1233 both holding an amount at the same date. (Though could of course could have one with value at Start of Period and the other having a value at the end of the period).
#	The Deferred Tax lines below should be seen as an analysis of how the balance (Instant Start/End) TxId 4062 is made up re DiMeId 128, DeferredTaxation. As this location indicates, Deferred Tax is a Dimension of Provisions for Liabilites.

########	NON BROS TXIDs - STUFF FOR GOING DIRECT TO REPORT GENERATOR ### NON BROS TXIDs - STUFF FOR GOING DIRECT TO REPORT GENERATOR ### NON BROS TXIDs - STUFF FOR GOING DIRECT TO REPORT GENERATOR ### NON BROS TXIDs - STUFF FOR GOING DIRECT TO REPORT GENERATOR ###
#
#	NOTE CW 07/12/2012. How the information below is handled depends in part on whether calculations are done within the AP program. If so then use AP data in conjnction with RG functionallity to calculate values.
#	NOTE CW 07/12/2012. If calculations are deemed to be within the control and verification of the AP system, then use existing raw data in conjnction with RG functionallity to calculate values.
#	NOTE CW 07/12/2012. If calculations and therefore values are external to AP system, then all BRAIINS is doing is recording a figure. In which case one could input it direct to BROs like any other InputSch data where there is no attempt to verify its accuracy.
#	NOTE CW 07/12/2012. There is a third way which combines both the above; directly enter raw data and calculated output. BROS does nothing to check relationship. But RG could have calculation reports that cross check. This might be the most effective way of handling such information.
#	NOTE CW 07/12/2012. It might also allow for calculated information to be generated by the RG but stored in BROs.
#

#	To align with common definitions have prefaced Fis that are not Derivatives as Primary.
7243	Set	1	  FinancialInstrument.Primary	 	Primary															Money	Debit	BS	DE								 +
#	To align with common definitions in have prefaced Fis that are not Derivatives as Primary. Have therefore also put Derivative on separate level from DerivavtiveAssets and Derivavtive Liabilities.
#	To align with common definitions have prefaced Fis that are not Derivatives as Primary.
#	There appears a small but possibly significant difference in treatment of CAI between UK GAAP and UK IFRS.
#	Both treat CAI as separate from Fair Value through P&L and Held for Trading. Shows in FI heading of Loans and Receivables
#	But GAAP gives CAI own row, IFRS shows merged in with Cash and cash equivalents.
#	It would seem logical that the assets at Fair Value through P&L (Held for Trading + Initial Recognition) should reconcile back to CAI analsys in various groupings. But even this looks dubious.
#	e.g.QuotedEquitySecurities TxId 4122. Is that supposed to equal to UK, Europe and US, be an alternative less detailed Class, or even a catch all for any Exchange that is not UK, Europe or US?
#	At present (10/08/2012) have not tried to align CAIs with FI - At Fair Value Through PL, but treated each as discrete granular values. O/S To revise in the future.

#	Cross checking.
#	Envisaged that BROS would look to check for accounting completeness and accuracy. But not do all possible logic checks - area for RG
#	Included would be arithmetic totals of related areas, or feeding through increasingly summarised informsation to fill values for various TxIds which are essentailly aggregares e.g. Operating Profit
#	Qu. 1a Need to work out what is best to do where one set of BROs may be Optional e.g. filling in details of Secured and Unsecured Loans (analysis not needed for Small Companies). In this case cannot set as Master and Slave. There use Check option
#	Qu. 1.b But also dangerous to use Check Equal To value. Since one value may be zero. (could only do this if had Zero or Null exception in logic). Problem of having spurious warnings if one set of info optional e.g. not required for say a Small Company.
#	Ans. DJH says that this is the default. Default position is that value being checked to does not thow an error if zero. (Logic areas such as Segmentmental analysis may be both optional and zero). So question is the reverse.
#	Current problem = force error when you know if one part contains a value, then Checked part must contain also data (and same value of data). Not valid to be zero.
#	Options on Secured, Unsecured and Total. Example based on Bank Overdraft
#	Import: e.g. SAPA. Map
#	- Map NL values 735:739 (Bank Current accounts, if credit balance - only shows < 1yr) to TxId 382. Map NLs 755:764 (Bank Loans <1 yr) and 825:834 (Bank Loans >1yr) to TxId 361.
#	- Map Secured (Memo NLs 1751 (<1yr) and Memo NL 1761 (>1yr) to TxId 370 (note SAPA does not separate between Bank Loans and Overdrafts re Ageing or Security).
#	#NAME?
#	- Options therefore:
#	a) Calculate unsecured as difference between total and secured. Fast and logical but what command to do it, removes a possible check
#	b) Assume that NL codes go to Unsecured value and then add back the secured. For the 95% that are Small, will not matter. For the 5% that are not they will need to adjust. So not ideal
#	Manual posting. Easy, post values to the Unsecured and Secured fields. Make the Total an RO.
#	Import or Manual, DJH pits in clever logic that looks to see if Entiy has been ticked as Small on set up and posted to Total value.
